title.narrative: 2.1. INCLUSIVE SECONDARY EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2021, the national and priority regional governments will have built their capacities to design and implement inclusive, relevant and quality secondary education policies that ensure successful development paths for indigenous, rural and marginal-urban adolescents., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Education â€“ General, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the adolescent population will have improved opportunities to live a healthy life, learn throughout their life and fully exercise their citizenship

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, the national and priority regional governments will have built their capacities to design and implement inclusive,relevant and quality secondary education policies that ensure successful development paths for indigenous, rural and marginal-urbanadolescents.

description.narrative: UNICEF&39;s work helped ensure that adolescents&39; education remained a priority, in the context of 2 years of school closure. With contributions from UNICEF, 1.8 million primary and secondary students received support to access and remain enrolled in schools. A new normative framework for the strategic development of the secondary school was approved; recent studies to inform policy were disseminated, contributing to prioritizing adolescents into the public agenda. UNICEF-designed training processes were scaled up, reaching 22% nationwide public secondary school teachers. The Ministry of Education recognized &39;the school model as a life experience (SEV) as a reference for welfare in secondary. | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/12/2021

title.narrative: Allocated budget for secondary education remains or increase.(48686)

baseline.value: National: 5,764,981,947 soles; Lima: 141,675,702 soles; Huancavelica: 105,001,071 soles; Loreto: 154,531,653; Ucayali: 69,348,825 soles

target.value: 2021:Exceed the average increase for Education sector.

title.narrative: Degree of design and implementation of the National Plan and Policy for the strengthening of secondary education.(48427)

baseline.value: Score 0: There is not any policy or plan.

target.value: 2021:Score 4: Policy and plan disseminated and incorporated into the annual management guidelines, and as a reference for the budgeting process of the sub-system of secondary education.

title.narrative: Degree of incorporation and implementation of comprehensive sex education in all secondary schools, in prioritized territories.(48689)

baseline.value: Score 1: There is not any type of comprehensive sex education in the majority of secondary schools.

target.value: 2021:Score 4: School teachers of at least 30% of secondary schools are trained in the use of the curriculum that incorporates comprehensive sex education.
